articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.title: Venezuela baseball says pros to return for playoffs, exempt from U.S. sanctions
articles.description: Players affiliated with Major League Baseball (MLB) will participate in Venezuela's upcoming playoffs, the country's baseball league said, after receiving an exemption from U.S. sanctions meant to force out socialist President Nicolas Maduro.
articles.content: CARACAS (Reuters) - Players affiliated with Major League Baseball (MLB) will participate in Venezuela’s upcoming playoffs, the country’s baseball league said, after receiving an exemption from U.S. sanctions meant to force out socialist President Nicolas Madu… [+1793 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: All protesters withdraw from U.S. embassy perimeter: Iraqi military
articles.description: All members of paramilitary groups and their supporters who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq have withdrawn from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad on Wednesday, the Iraqi military said.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - All members of paramilitary groups and their supporters who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq have withdrawn from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad on Wednesday, the Iraqi military said. 
“All protesters hav… [+267 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Strike not extended at Lufthansa's Germanwings for now
articles.description: The trade union representing cabin crew at Lufthansa's budget airline Germanwings decided on Wednesday not to continue their strike for the time being after three days of stoppages led to dozens of flights being canceled.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - The trade union representing cabin crew at Lufthansa’s (LHAG.DE) budget airline Germanwings decided on Wednesday not to continue their strike for the time being after three days of stoppages led to dozens of flights being canceled.

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul
articles.title: Ghosn met Lebanese president after fleeing Japan - sources
articles.description: Fugitive former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn met Lebanon's president after his escape from Japan, where he was smuggled out of house arrest by a private security company, two sources close to Ghosn said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
BEIRUT (Reuters) - Fugitive former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn met Lebanon’s president after his escape from Japan, where he was smuggled out of house arrest by a private security company, two sources close to Ghosn said on Wednesday.

articles.author: Ali Mirghani
articles.title: More than 20 dead, many displaced after violence in Sudan's West Darfur
articles.description: At least 24 people were confirmed killed after a camp for internally displaced people was attacked in Sudan's West Darfur, an international peacekeeping official said on Wednesday, as top officials arrived to try to calm the violence.
articles.content:
KHARTOUM (Reuters) - At least 24 people were confirmed killed after a camp for internally displaced people was attacked in Sudan’s West Darfur, an international peacekeeping official said on Wednesday, as top officials arrived to try to calm the violence.
